    Swarm

    reactive data sync middleware

    Java version is in the works

    By Victor Grishchenko September 17, 2014 September 17, 2014 Comment Permalink Like Tweet +1

    Swarm is a generic CRDT-based model for data synchronization that works in real time. Swarm is highly tolerant to asynchronous environments, including the most extreme case of it: offline work. As an algorithm, Swarm can be implemented in any programming language. It was a little bit annoying that we only had a JavaScript version so far. Not anymore.

    Finally, the Java version is making its first steps both on the server side and on Android devices:

    That brings us one step closer to the vision of replicated model being the new hourglass waist of distributed app architectures.

    Replicated model everywhere!
